om.qengine
Class OmService

java.lang.Object
  om.qengine.OmService
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.xml.rpc.server.ServiceLifecycle, QEngineConfig
public class OmService
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.xml.rpc.server.ServiceLifecycle, QEngineConfig

Question engine Web service. This contains all public methods of the question engine. Actual work is deferred to the om.question package.

Method Detail

start

public StartReturn start(java.lang.String questionID,
                         java.lang.String questionVersion,
                         java.lang.String questionBaseURL,
                         java.lang.String[] initialParamNames,
                         java.lang.String[] initialParamValues,
                         java.lang.String[] cachedResources)
                  throws OmException
Creates a new question session for the given question.

API METHOD: This method signature must not be changed in future (after initial release) unless careful attention is paid to simultaneous changes of Test Navigator. In general, if additional parameters or return values are added, a new method should be defined.

Obtaining question file

If the question engine already has this question in its cache, it will use that (questions of the same version are guaranteed not to change). Otherwise it retrieves questions using the following URL:

questionBaseURL/questionID.questionversion

For security reasons, the URL may be https: and the test navigator (which is likely to be the thing serving the URL) will operate an IP whitelist, only responding to requests from question engines it has already initiated connections to.

Initial parameters

initialParamNames and initialParamValues (which must be of equal length) include initial configuration parameters to be passed to the question.
NameValue
randomseedRandom number seed given to question, which should be based on the current user, the test, and the number of times they've started this question before. Parsed as decimal integer (up to 64 bit)

Parameters:
questionID - Unique ID of question
questionVersion - Version identifier of question (should include only filename-space characters, probably just digits and full stops). May be null, to indicate that the question may not be cached (for preview usage only)
questionBaseURL - Base URL for questions (see above)
initialParamNames - Names of initial parameters
initialParamValues - Values of initial parameters
cachedResources - List of resources that the Test Navigator has cached
Returns:
Various data in order to provide the initial page of the question
Throws:
OmException - Whenever something goes wrong

getQuestionMetadata

public java.lang.String getQuestionMetadata(java.lang.String questionID,
                                            java.lang.String questionVersion,
                                            java.lang.String questionBaseURL)
                                     throws OmException
Obtains XML metadata about a question. Metadata currently is of the form: 
 <questionmetadata>
 <plainmode>yes</plainmode> (or 'no')
 <title>My Fun Question</title> (optional if question has no title)
 </questionmetadata>

Order of the content is not significant and callers must accept changes in order as well as additional tags.

This mechanism may be changed at some point because we might start storing metadata independently of the question engine, bu for now...

API METHOD: This method signature must not be changed in future (after initial release) unless careful attention is paid to simultaneous changes of Test Navigator. In general, if additional parameters or return values are added, a new method should be defined.

Parameters:
questionID - Unique ID of question
questionVersion - Version identifier of question (should include only filename-space characters, probably just digits and full stops). May be null, to indicate that the question may not be cached (for preview usage only)
questionBaseURL - Base URL for questions (see above)
Returns:
True if it's OK in plain mode, false if it isn't
Throws:
OmException - Whenever something goes wrong

stop

public void stop(java.lang.String questionSession)
          throws OmException
Stops a given question session, freeing up resources.

If a question session is not stopped after a given timeout (possibly 24 hours) since last start(String,String,String,String[],String[],String[]) or process(String, String[], String[]), the question engine should automatically time-out the session.

API METHOD: This method signature must not be changed in future (after initial release) unless careful attention is paid to simultaneous changes of Test Navigator. In general, if additional parameters or return values are added, a new method should be defined.

Parameters:
questionSession -
Throws:
OmException

process

public ProcessReturn process(java.lang.String questionSession,
                             java.lang.String[] names,
                             java.lang.String[] values)
                      throws OmException
Processes a user's action in a question session.

A user's action consists of a number of name-value pairs. These are generally the form parameters from the user's submission, but other information may be included here if needed.

If the action occurred in plain mode then the following name/value pair - "plain","yes" - must be included in the parameters. This is because questions can accept plain-mode actions even when the question itself was not started in plain mode (e.g. when playing through steps to restart a question that was initially attempted in plain mode).

API METHOD: This method signature must not be changed in future (after initial release) unless careful attention is paid to simultaneous changes of Test Navigator. In general, if additional parameters or return values are added, a new method should be defined.

Parameters:
questionSession - Question session ID
names - Form names in user's answer
values - Form parameters (must be an array of equal size to names)
Returns:
New XHTML etc.
Throws:
OmException
